text: are you looking for a super delicious
make-ahead breakfast how about a cheesy
potato and broccoli custard so fantastic
and it's completely make-ahead
in fact so make-ahead you can make a
head the day I have except for the
cooking part it's almost completely
make-ahead you need two and a half cups
of grated cheese I like to use a cheddar
cheese extra sharp is my favorite but
sharp works as well about two and a half
cups or eight ounces total put that into
a large bowl everything's going to get
combined together and then sit overnight
or at least two hours in the
refrigerator
you also need four scallions about a
half a cup sliced I like a mild scallion
here as opposed to an onion because
onion flavor I find has a tendency to
strengthen over time and things that are
made ahead I like to go with something
mild like a chive or a scallion plus
it's a nice little pit of color in there
that can go in your bowl as well you're
going to need a nice big bowl this
serves a lot of people and I'm going to
be adding about six cups of potato to
you also need four teaspoons of Dijon
mustard and a half a cup of Greek yogurt
nice tang you can also use sour cream if
you're so inclined now for the potatoes
these potatoes that I'm using have been
precooked and completely cooled and then
you peel them they're not soft enough to
eat quite yet but they're soft enough
that you don't need to cook them that
long once you add them to your casserole
so there's sort of par cooked I would
say have four russet potatoes and they
need to be peeled once they've been
completely cooled you just put them in a
pot cover them with cold water bring it
to a boil and then simmer it for just 10
minutes not too long does take a while
for it to come to a boil though so I'd
say it probably takes about 25 minutes
start to finish you want to grate your
potatoes on the same hole that you
graded your cheese for the large holes
of the box grater some nice big shreds
and you're going to need a total of six
cups which you should get from four sort
of medium sized
potatoes you'll need a total of six and
a half cups to me this looks a little
more than six and a half cups but I'm
just gonna go it actually I'll just stop
grading add that to your cheese mixture
so what's going on here is that these
potatoes are precooked enough to be sort
of a little bit starchy instead of all
wet but they're not so cooked that
they'll turn to mush when you put them
when you cook them further because this
gets cooked in a skillet so it's nice
and crispy on the bottom and you don't
want to overdo it you also need four
cups of broccoli florets in bite-sized
pieces and then five large eggs I'm
going to beat those before I put them
into the bowl so this is the mixture
that you can make up to a day ahead
bring that in add two teaspoons of salt
half a teaspoon of pepper give it a stir
the broccoli is not precooked it's going
to cook in the pan alongside everything
else the heat of the back part cooking
process will cook them now you can add
your eggs stir that fully combined and
then then this will go into the
refrigerator for at least two hours and
up to overnight so when you're ready to
cook this what you want to do is cook
some bacon take it out you're going to
serve the bacon on top of your casserole
so just get it onto some paper towels to
drain and then in that same skillet it's
a very large cast iron skillet you're
going to melt a couple tablespoons of
butter and that's what you're going to
cook your potato mixture in if there's a
lot of bacon fat in here you're going to
want to get rid of that because you
don't want it to be overly bacony when
we were developing this at first we
started by cooking it just in the bacon
fat and it was to bacony but if you're a
huge huge baking pan sure go ahead
drain all but two tablespoons of the
bacon fat
now what you want to do is start off the
cooking process on top of the stove and
then finish it in the oven so you're
going to get it a little crispy on the
bottom on top of the stove kind of like
a big very very very very very potatoey
frittata you start cooking just for
about 8 minutes on the stove while
you're doing this part you can pre-heat
your oven to 400 degrees because you're
going to need it hot when you transfer
this to your oven you just want to cook
this till it starts to set it's a little
hard to tell if it's set right because
mostly potatoes it's not like a regular
frittata but you're trying to get a
little bit of crispness you can shape
your potato mixture around the edges
sort of pushing in with your spatula
flattening out so that you get a nice
compact shape and then just do that
until it starts to get crisp on the
bottom and it begins to set on the
bottom you're not going to really notice
that much on the top all right after
about 8 minutes you're just going to
want to get this into the oven and cook
it until it's completely set and
starting to turn golden on top that
should take about 20-25 minutes and it
is done down in delicious I do recommend
that if you take something out of the
oven that might not appear to have been
taken out of the oven that you leave
something over the handles in case
somebody decides to touch them you don't
want them to burn themselves so I always
do that
spoon it up you can give it a nice
garnish of some bacon that's more
beautiful right how about a little more
Greek yogurt
and then some more scallions a little
quickly
cheddar potato broccoli casserole I say
absolutely
and you're gonna say yes to want to try
